question:
What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int number1 = -17;
int number2 = -5;
int result = number1 % number2;
printf("%d", result);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
char line[] = "Welcome to WingerIT on C Programming";
char string1[10], string2[10], string3[10];
sscanf(line, "%*s %*s %s %*s %*s %s %s", string1, string2, string3);
printf("%s %s %s\n", string1, string2, string3);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int array[10] = {3, 0, 8, 1, 12, 8, 9, 2, 13, 10};
int x, y, z;
x = ++array[2];
y = array[2]++;
z = array[x++];
printf("%d %d %d", x, y, z);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int x = 6;
int y = 4;
int z;
if(!x >= 5)
y = 3;
z = 2;
printf("%d %d", z, y);
return 0;
}

Predict the output of the following segment of code:
// ASSUME 64-bit compiler
// Add stdio.h and stdlib.h header file in below code

#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main()
{
struct DataFlair
{
int value;
struct DataFlair *link;
};
struct DataFlair *x, *y;
x = (struct DataFlair *) malloc(sizeof(struct DataFlair));
y = (struct DataFlair *) malloc(sizeof(struct DataFlair));
printf("%ld %ld", sizeof(x), sizeof(y));
return 0;
}

If n and p are unsigned int variables in a C program, we wish to set p to nC3. If n is large, which of the following statements is most likely to set p correctly?

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int a, b;
printf("Enter two integers: ");
scanf("%d %d", &a, &b);
printf("Sum: %d ", a + b);
printf("Difference: %d ", a - b);
printf("Product: %d ", a * b);
if (b != 0) {
printf("Quotient: %.2f ", (float)a / b);
} else {
printf("Cannot divide by zero. ");
}
return 0;
}
choice1: Sum, Difference, Product, and Quotient of the two integers
choice2: Sum and Product of the two integers
choice3: Sum and Difference of the two integers
choice4: Difference and Product of the two integers

question:
What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int arr[] = {3, 5, 1, 8, 7};
int i, largest = arr[0], smallest = arr[0];
for (i = 1; i < 5; i++) {
if (arr[i] > largest) largest = arr[i];
if (arr[i] < smallest) smallest = arr[i];
}
printf("Largest: %d\n", largest);
printf("Smallest: %d\n", smallest);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
char str[] = "hello";
int length = strlen(str);
for (int i = length - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
printf("%c", str[i]);
}
printf("\n");
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int A[2][2] = { {1, 2}, {3, 4} };
int B[2][2] = { {2, 0}, {1, 3} };
int C[2][2];
for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
C[i][j] = 0;
for (int k = 0; k < 2; k++) {
C[i][j] += A[i][k] * B[k][j];
}
}
}
for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
for (int j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
printf("%d ", C[i][j]);
}
printf("\n");
}
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int n = 5, a = 0, b = 1, c;
printf("%d %d ", a, b);
for (int i = 2; i < n; i++) {
c = a + b;
printf("%d ", c);
a = b;
b = c;
}
printf("\n");
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int num = 29, i, isPrime = 1;
for (i = 2; i <= num / 2; i++) {
if (num % i == 0) {
isPrime = 0;
break;
}
}
if (isPrime)
printf("Prime\n");
else
printf("Not Prime\n");
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int num = 5, factorial = 1;
for (int i = 1; i <= num; i++) {
factorial *= i;
}
printf("Factorial: %d\n", factorial);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
char str[] = "radar";
int length = strlen(str);
int flag = 1;
for (int i = 0; i < length / 2; i++) {
if (str[i] != str[length - i - 1]) {
flag = 0;
break;
}
}
if (flag)
printf("Palindrome\n");
else
printf("Not Palindrome\n");
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int arr[] = {64, 34, 25, 12, 22};
int n = 5;
for (int i = 0; i < n-1; i++) {
for (int j = 0; j < n-i-1; j++) {
if (arr[j] > arr[j+1]) {
int temp = arr[j];
arr[j] = arr[j+1];
arr[j+1] = temp;
}
}
}
for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
printf("%d ", arr[i]);
}
printf("\n");
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
FILE *file;
char ch;
file = fopen("sample.txt", "w");
if (file == NULL) {
printf("Error opening file\n");
return 1;
}
fprintf(file, "Hello, File I/O!");
fclose(file);
file = fopen("sample.txt", "r");
if (file == NULL) {
printf("Error opening file\n");
return 1;
}
while ((ch = fgetc(file)) != EOF) {
putchar(ch);
}
fclose(file);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
struct Node {
int data;
struct Node* next;
};
void printList(struct Node* n) {
while (n != NULL) {
printf("%d ", n->data);
n = n->next;
}
printf("\n");
}
int main() {
struct Node* head = (struct Node*)malloc(sizeof(struct Node));
struct Node* second = (struct Node*)malloc(sizeof(struct Node));
struct Node* third = (struct Node*)malloc(sizeof(struct Node));
head->data = 1;
head->next = second;
second->data = 2;
second->next = third;
third->data = 3;
third->next = NULL;
printList(head);
return 0;
}
}

What is the output of the following program?

int binarySearch(int arr[], int size, int target) {
int left = 0, right = size - 1;
while (left <= right) {
int mid = left + (right - left) / 2;
if (arr[mid] == target) {
return mid;
}
if (arr[mid] < target) {
left = mid + 1;
} else {
right = mid - 1;
}
}
return -1;
}
int main() {
int arr[] = {1, 3, 5, 7, 9};
int size = sizeof(arr) / sizeof(arr[0]);
int index = binarySearch(arr, size, 7);
printf("Index: %d\n", index);
return 0;
}

What is the output of the following program?

int main()
{
int *arr;
int n = 5;
arr = (int*)malloc(n * sizeof(int));
if (arr == NULL) {
printf("Memory allocation failed\n");
return 1;
}
for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
arr[i] = i * 2;
}
for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
printf("%d ", arr[i]);
}
printf("\n");
free(arr);
return 0;
}
